title: Been playing alot of Ekko and I'd like a QoL change please.
body: Can your own team see where your W is placed so they can make plays around it?

replies.body:
uh....

your teammates can see this...

While in general you are correct, it shows for allies at the same time as it shows for enemies, so allies can't see the first second or so. I believe he is asking for allies to have the same indicator (ie the whole time) as Ekko gets.

I'm fairly certain that allies get the indicator the whole way through. Here's my comparison that I just tested on my machine (as in I am both the ekko and the ahri: rito black magic!)



https://imgur.com/a/jOkqD

As far as I can tell, as soon as Ekko presses the button both he & his allies get the VFX. I have never had any issues playing around my allied Ekko's stuns in the past, so personally am unsure as to why we have different viewpoints.

SPEAKING OF QOLS

Can Taliyah q on worked ground when she has enough mana for it but not when she isn't on worked ground?

Currently if she has no mana and gets enough for the half cost of a single q she can't cast it until she gets enough mana for the full q despite being on worked ground.

That’s not QoL, that’s a buff.

Currently the cost of her Q on Worked Ground is _refunded_, not _reduced_. That’s by design.
Correct. Important distinction, good eye

except leblanc also has a hell of a lot less survival tools and has a much bigger window of opportunity. All of Leblanc's tools need to be used in one way and not both. If she uses W to dodge damage, she doesnt damage people with it. Once her chain is gone, theres a window.

Ekko has no window. With egregious amounts of cdr going around his next ability is always gonna be up in 4 seconds, an he can use all of his abilities defensively while still also using them to pump damage on you.

Pump damage on you to get a massive movespeed to get away

Shield himself and stun you for extra damage at the same time

Become untargetable for a getaway/dodge and damage you at the same time.

Leblanc doesnt have these things.

Lets do some math here.

Assuming leblanc hits you with her entire combo (E mimic) at level 8, (4 points E, 1 Q, 2 W, 1 R) her base damage is 590 +  330% ap

Assuming Ekko hits you with the same (4 Q, 2 E, 1 W, 1 R) His base damage is 515, + 360% ap. Plus however many %missing hp attacks.

Thats also assuming ekko doesnt use an extra ability or two in the time it would take for both of your chains to detonate. So in reality, Ekko is gonna be a lot harder to play around, use all of his tools both defensively AND offensively (healing, shielding, dodging and stunning), while still having better mana costs, waveclear, and more damage.

Comparing him to leblanc is a pitiful analogy.
